intro: Guapurium fruticosum, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming an invasive species.
